page.title: 01REVIEW WASHINGTON/GATESHEAD
page.content: The block divides into three areas: the{North and West}is high density {housing,}some post war but definitely overspill from the Tyneside conurbation. In the{South and East is the Northern edge of{Washington New {Town,}including the Development Corporation Headquarters and mainly private and Council housing. Between is a broad{greenbelt}of agricultural land on which New Town development is forbidden. The region's prosperity hinged on coal mining and associated industries. Little of this remains. In its place are{lighter industries, an emphasis upon the service sector and{leisure.}The New Town population consists of old established families, people from Sunderland and Newcastle and those attracted by jobs. There is good provision of public transport, schools, churches and social welfare.
